intro: Mapouria tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly mapouria, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, grayish foliage, which gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Native to tropical regions of Africa, it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a unique subject for botanical study and horticultural interest.
